title: Stock Futures Gain as Earnings Season Moves Past Banks; Netflix, Johnson & Johnson and Hasbro are due to report results
text:
Europe stocks fell Tuesday. The Stoxx Europe 600 was down 0.2% in morning trade. Industrials and consumer discretionary sectors drove the losses while healthcare and utilities sectors rose.

Electricité de France jumped 15.4%. Carnival slipped 3.5% and Delivery Hero declined 3.6%.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 was lower 0.3%. Other stock indexes in Europe also mostly fell as France's CAC 40 lost 0.5%, the FTSE 250 shed 0.4% and Germany's DAX lost 0.4%.

The Swiss franc, the euro and the British pound gained 0.4%, 0.3% and 0.3% respectively against the U.S. dollar.

In commodities, international benchmark Brent crude remained flat, at $106.32 a barrel. Gold slipped 0.2% to $1,706.00 a troy ounce.

German 10-year bund yields were down to 1.192% and the U.K. 10-year gilts yield declined to 2.110%. The yield on 10-year U.S. Treasurys rose to 2.974% from 2.959%. Yields move in the opposite direction from prices.

Indexes in Asia were mixed as Japan's Nikkei 225 index added 0.6% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite was flat after losing 0.7% during the session, whereas Hong Kong's Hang Seng fell 0.5%.

—An artificial-intelligence tool was used in creating this article.

Stock Futures Gain as Earnings Season Moves Past Banks
